title: How to delete Thunderbird
content:
Hi from Australia!

I've just noticed that Thunderbird is the biggest user of storage space on my HP desktop computer, at 55.5GB.

I've tried to delete it, because I have my own email program and never use Thunderbird.

But when I try to uninstall Thunderbird, I get the following message:

"E:\uninstall.helper.exe The system cannot find the drive specified"

It's: "Mozilla Thunderbird (x64 en-US) 102.9.1 Mozilla 7/04/2023 55.5GB"

Thanks for considering this,

Kind regards,

Tom Brisbane Queensland

title: I have Thunderbird 115.9.0 (64-bit) and made a backup of everything now I cannot restore it
content: At Christmas last year I made a complete back-up which came to 6.1Gb. This March my computer crashed and I had to re-install the operating system and all of its programs including Thunderbird. But the backup zip file (when extracted to a folder from the zip file) is in sqllite files, not profile or ics calendar formats. Thus the backup cannot be restored. How do I get Thunderbird to accept these types of files to import the address book, calendar and message filter?

title: Message pane flashing intermittently/randomly - blocks other actions
content:
Thunderbird v 115.9.0

The message pane will start randomly flashing Once this starts, its almost impossible to perform any other action in TB ( other apps OK)

I have completely uninstalled TB and cleared out the Thunderbird section in %AppData% before re-installing TB again Will seem OK to start with after re-install, but the problem soon comes back

Anyone seen similar ?

title: Add-ons shown as incompatible in one (main) profile, but not in other (newly created) profile
content: Hi all, When trying to install Thunderbird add-ons in my (main) profile, many add-ons are listed as being "not compatible to your version of Thunderbird" (which is TB 115.9.0 on openSUSE Tumbleweed; installation is still possible via xpi file). But in a newly created test profile (on the same system), the add-ons are listed without this "error". Please see attached screenshot with both profiles side-by-side with ImportExport Tool NG as an example. Thus, it appears that my main profile has become mangled up somewhat. (Which is not completely surprising given that it has been in continuous use for about 20 years.) Do you have any idea what may cause this issue and / or how to clean-up my standard profile? Many thanks!
creator: akki.42

title: A lot of my emails when selected will incorrectly show the content of the first Inbox email
content:
Hi, for some severely annoying reason all emails from 2nd Jan 2021 to 6th June 2022 when clicked will show the wrong content. In fact the email from 1st Jan 2021 (the first one in the Inbox). I don't know when this problem started because I don't generally look at emails that old. I suspect it happen since two months ago when I last looked up historic emails. I vaguely remember doing a compact in the last few months (it was recommended after all).

Unfortunately I have got a bit lazy with my inbox. It currently contains 1450 emails from the past three years. It seems (now) that is not recommended but why the feck should the amount lead to corruption?? If you can store 2 messages you should be able to store at least 2^32 for crying out loud! It's all just 7-bit ASCII FFS!

So how on earth am I going to fix this?! I have old backups but how do I merge messages from one account to the current live one?

(Recently running Thunderbird v115.9.0 32-bit from v109.something.something)
creator: michael.b.harris.uk

Windows 8.1, long term Thunderbird user and donor. Michael, UK
creator: Michael-was-suppliers1

title: Making Thunderbird user friendly
content:
Three things that I feel should be changed in Thunderbird

1. A toggle switch to highlight that we chave received email in a thread. I can spend hours looking for why the folder shows I got an email, yet none of the messages are highlighted.

2. When I want something to be opened in a new tab, I want to switch to the new tab. This again can be a toggle.

3. More of the configure editor settings should be brought out to regular settings with better descriptions. Coders are not the best choice for labeling something.

None of this is an emergency, but there will be a point in the level of frustration that can cause folks to jump ship. As an example when I got a 4k screen, trying to get everything in Thunderbird to fit properly took hours and I am still not happy with the out come. I am hearing that there are a lot of folks, not all, that are frustrated with Thundebird.
creator: TheMichiganOldFarmer

title: how to change all folders to sort by unthreaded?
content: Thunderbird's most annoying problem - by default all email strings are sorted by threading which causes many problems as all the users who have contributed to this issue in many blog threads have said. I am using the latest now - ver 115.9.0 (windows) and i know how to manually change a folder's contents to sort by unthreaded but i have literally hundreds of folders in my thunderbird and to change each on the fly would take hours. Is there NO way to change the default for existing folders to sort by unthreaded? It seems like this would be a simple setting to have included in thunderbird. In the last posting i read still no one has a solution: https://support.mozilla.org/en-US/questions/1425531?page=2 Can anyone offer any assistance? thank you all

creator: donmohle

title: Thunderbird 115.9.0 64bit on Ubuntu Rejects Password
content:
I have Thunderbird 115.9.0 64 bit on the 2nd latest version of Ubuntu Linux and by second latest I mean it is still supported even though there is a new version available. Several months ago there was a password problem with my internet account preventing me from logging into my internet/email service and all my devices could not send or recieve emails. I changed my password on my cell, my Windows 10 computers and they worked fine. My Thunderbird on my Ubuntu on the other hand rejected my password and I also checked all of my port and server settings with the help of my internet service provider tech support including comparing settings from other email clients. Still no password being accepted. My internet/email service provider tech agent suggested removing my account from my client and reentering it and this worked.

Several months later I changed my main email passwords again on incoming mail and outgoing mail servers on my account, verified my port settings are correct, which they were including the type of security and protocols used. When I select the desktop icon I get prompted to enter my main password and hit enter and the window keeps reoccurring as if it has rejected my password. I select cancel allowing me to enter and again clear and reenter password and again it is rejected. I removed my account (I think) and go through the motions of reinstalling my account and get a pop-up indicating the server already exists which puzzles me. Ports, security settings, password are all correct and tested on other devices. I can even use a browser and log onto my internet service providers server and access my account and my password works but not on my Thunderbird. Should I consider uninstalling and then reinstalling my Thunderbird on my Ubuntu? I think by mistake I deleted all of my emails BUT I have selected IMAP so my emails I want are still on my service providers server. IF I uninstall and reinstall how do I save my contact list. This I Inoticed is still intact. Suggestions please?
creator: donhenschel
